alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:44PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTY THROUGH 615 PM MDT... At 544 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles northwest of Caprock to 20 miles northwest of Maljamar. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Chaves County. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 181 and 200. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Frequent dangerous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for southeastern New Mexico.
